column4: hello. i just used ifconfig and iwconfig (along with ubuntu's network tool) to configure access to my wireless ap. dhclient ath0 worked, i got my own ip and /etc/resolv.conf was written, but still i can't ping my dns, anybody know what i'm missing?
what does netstat -ran shows?  does it have a gateway?
cool, it gateway shows 0.0.0.0, and the other 10.0.0.0
are those really valid ip addres?
no =) how do i set them?
then make sure that is the correct gateway then..
i tried route add default 10.0.0.138 but that didn't work
keep looking at the result of that netstat -ran and see if gateway gets added
maybe use the network manager to add
isn't there a configuration file somewhere?
the gateway too resides in there?
yes, for static at least am sure..
you need to make sure the gateway is working
well do you have any suggestions?
can you paste-bin your netstat -ran result?
